flawed_nl_solution:
The total ratio representing the 500 cards is 11+9 = <<11+9=21>>21
The fraction of the total ratio that represents the number of cards that Ellis got is 11/21, and since there were 500 cards, Ellis got 11/21*500 = <<11/21*500=5500/21>>5500/21
If there were 500 cards, and Ellis received 5500/21 cards, Orion received 500-5500/21 = <<500-5500/21=5000/21>>5000/21 cards
The number of cards that Ellis received more than Orion is 5500/21-5000/21 = <<5500/21-5000/21=500/21>>500/21 cards.
#### 500/21

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 21. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
